scheme_data.schemeName: AICTE – Mitacs Globalink Research Internship (GRI) Scheme
scheme_data.shortDescription: {"id": "ZQKLHI0BsSMYTfzi8uBt", "fields": {"beneficiaryState": ["All"], "schemeShortTitle": "AM-GRIS", "level": "Central", "nodalMinistryName": "Ministry of Education", "schemeCategory": ["Education & Learning"], "schemeName": "AICTE \u2013 Mitacs Globalink Research Internship (GRI) Scheme", "schemeCloseDate": null, "slug": "am-gris", "briefDescription": "AICTE, on 23rd February 2018, entered into a Memorandum of Understanding with Mathematics of Information Technology and Computer Systems (MITACS) Canada for AICTE \u2013 MITACS Globalink Research Internships (GRI) Program to foster cross-border partnerships.", "age": {"ews": {"gte": 18, "lte": 100}, "sc": {"gte": 18, "lte": 100}, "general": {"gte": 18, "lte": 100}, "obc": {"gte": 18, "lte": 100}, "st": {"gte": 18, "lte": 100}, "female": {"gte": 18, "lte": 100}, "widowed": {"gte": 18, "lte": 100}}, "tags": ["Internship", "Research"]}, "highlight": {}}
scheme_data.description:
The name of this welfare scheme is AICTE – Mitacs Globalink Research Internship (GRI) Scheme. It is also known as AM-GRIS. AICTE, on 23rd February 2018, entered into a Memorandum of Understanding with Mathematics of Information Technology and Computer Systems (MITACS) Canada for AICTE – MITACS Globalink Research Internships (GRI) Program to foster cross-border partnerships focused on creating a platform that opens the path for collaborative research between Canada and India to a wider pool of student talent in India. The AICTE-MITACS GRI Program is open to Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) disciplines. The duration of the internship is 12 weeks. A maximum of 300 students are accepted in a financial year. The student fulfilling the eligibility criteria shall apply directly to MITACS Canada via its portal. The total cost of the program is $12,000 CAD per student. MITACS will contribute $9,000 CAD per student. AICTE will contribute $3,000 CAD per student. The full cost per student includes airfare, visa, medical, stipend, accommodation, Globalink Student Mentors, programming, and research costs. It will also include access to Globalink branded activities in Canada, which may include professional skills workshops, receptions, and industrial engagement activities. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. The implementing agency is AICTE And Mitacs. Additionally, the nodal ministry is Ministry of Education and the nodal department is Department Of Higher Education.

It falls under the categories: Education & Learning.

Eligibility criteria include: The applicant must be a 3rdyear fulltime student of an undergraduate program (B.E / B.Tech) in AICTE Approved Institution in the year of application.
The applicant must have a minimum CGPA / GPA of 85% in 2nd year.
The applicant must be at least 18 years of age.
The applicant must be able to spend twelve (12) weeks between May and September at a university in Canada on a research project related to their area of interest and expertise.
The applicant must be able to demonstrate oral and written fluency in English or French, depending on the primary language of the project as indicated by the Canadian host professor. For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www.aicte-india.org/sites/default/files/stdc/Mitacs%20Scheme%20Guidelines.pdf Tags associated with the scheme include: Internship, Research.

scheme_data.combined_text:
The name of this welfare scheme is AICTE – Mitacs Globalink Research Internship (GRI) Scheme. It is also known as AM-GRIS. AICTE, on 23rd February 2018, entered into a Memorandum of Understanding with Mathematics of Information Technology and Computer Systems (MITACS) Canada for AICTE – MITACS Globalink Research Internships (GRI) Program to foster cross-border partnerships focused on creating a platform that opens the path for collaborative research between Canada and India to a wider pool of student talent in India. The AICTE-MITACS GRI Program is open to Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) disciplines. The duration of the internship is 12 weeks. A maximum of 300 students are accepted in a financial year. The student fulfilling the eligibility criteria shall apply directly to MITACS Canada via its portal. The total cost of the program is $12,000 CAD per student. MITACS will contribute $9,000 CAD per student. AICTE will contribute $3,000 CAD per student. The full cost per student includes airfare, visa, medical, stipend, accommodation, Globalink Student Mentors, programming, and research costs. It will also include access to Globalink branded activities in Canada, which may include professional skills workshops, receptions, and industrial engagement activities. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. The implementing agency is AICTE And Mitacs. Additionally, the nodal ministry is Ministry of Education and the nodal department is Department Of Higher Education.

It falls under the categories: Education & Learning.

Eligibility criteria include: The applicant must be a 3rdyear fulltime student of an undergraduate program (B.E / B.Tech) in AICTE Approved Institution in the year of application.
The applicant must have a minimum CGPA / GPA of 85% in 2nd year.
The applicant must be at least 18 years of age.
The applicant must be able to spend twelve (12) weeks between May and September at a university in Canada on a research project related to their area of interest and expertise.
The applicant must be able to demonstrate oral and written fluency in English or French, depending on the primary language of the project as indicated by the Canadian host professor. For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www.aicte-india.org/sites/default/files/stdc/Mitacs%20Scheme%20Guidelines.pdf Tags associated with the scheme include: Internship, Research.

sentences.sent: The name of this welfare scheme is AICTE – Mitacs Globalink Research Internship (GRI) Scheme.
It is also known as AM-GRIS.

AICTE, on 23rd February 2018, entered into a Memorandum of Understanding with Mathematics of Information Technology and Computer Systems (MITACS) Canada for AICTE – MITACS Globalink Research Internships (GRI) Program to foster cross-border partnerships focused on creating a platform that opens the path for collaborative research between Canada and India to a wider pool of student talent in India.
The AICTE-MITACS GRI Program is open to Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) disciplines.
The duration of the internship is 12 weeks.
A maximum of 300 students are accepted in a financial year.
The student fulfilling the eligibility criteria shall apply directly to MITACS Canada via its portal.
The total cost of the program is $12,000 CAD per student.
MITACS will contribute $9,000 CAD per student.
AICTE will contribute $3,000 CAD per student.
The full cost per student includes airfare, visa, medical, stipend, accommodation, Globalink Student Mentors, programming, and research costs.
It will also include access to Globalink branded activities in Canada, which may include professional skills workshops, receptions, and industrial engagement activities.
The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual.
The implementing agency is AICTE And Mitacs.
Additionally, the nodal ministry is Ministry of Education and the nodal department is Department Of Higher Education.
It falls under the categories: Education & Learning.
Eligibility criteria include: The applicant must be a 3rdyear fulltime student of an undergraduate program (B.
E / B.
Tech) in AICTE Approved Institution in the year of application.
The applicant must have a minimum CGPA / GPA of 85% in 2nd year.
The applicant must be at least 18 years of age.
The applicant must be able to spend twelve (12) weeks between May and September at a university in Canada on a research project related to their area of interest and expertise.
The applicant must be able to demonstrate oral and written fluency in English or French, depending on the primary language of the project as indicated by the Canadian host professor.
For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www.
aicte-india.
org/sites/default/files/stdc/Mitacs%20Scheme%20Guidelines.
pdf Tags associated with the scheme include: Internship, Research.

", "detailedDescription": [{"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "AICTE, on 23rd February 2018, entered into a Memorandum of Understanding with Mathematics of Information Technology and Computer Systems (MITACS) Canada for AICTE \u2013 MITACS Globalink Research Internships (GRI) Program to foster cross-border partnerships focused on creating a platform that opens the path for collaborative research between Canada and India to a wider pool of student talent in India.
The AICTE-MITACS GRI Program is open to Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) disciplines.
The duration of the internship is 12 weeks.
A maximum of 300 students are accepted in a financial year.
The student fulfilling the eligibility criteria shall apply directly to MITACS Canada via its portal.
The total cost of the program is $12,000 CAD per student.
MITACS will contribute $9,000 CAD per student.
AICTE will contribute $3,000 CAD per student.
The full cost per student includes airfare, visa, medical, stipend, accommodation, Globalink Student Mentors, programming, and research costs.
It will also include access to Globalink branded activities in Canada, which may include professional skills workshops, receptions, and industrial engagement activities.

\n"}, "applicationProcess": [{"mode": "Offline", "url": "", "process": [{"type": "block_quote", "children": [{"text": "PROCEDURE TO APPLY", "bold": true}]}, {"type": "ol_list", "children": [{"type": "list_item", "children": [{"text": "The student fulfilling the eligibility criteria shall apply directly to MITACS Canada via its portal and follow the procedure, guidelines, and terms and conditions mentioned therein;"}]}, {"type": "list_item", "children": [{"text": "All materials submitted to MITACS must be in either English or French.

E / B.
Tech) in AICTE Approved Institution in the year of application.
The applicant must have a minimum CGPA / GPA of 85% in 2nd year.
The applicant must be at least 18 years of age.
The applicant must be able to spend twelve (12) weeks between May and September at a university in Canada on a research project related to their area of interest and expertise.
The applicant must be able to demonstrate oral and written fluency in English or French, depending on the primary language of the project as indicated by the Canadian host professor.

ctus.text: The name of this welfare scheme is AICTE – Mitacs Globalink Research Internship (GRI) Scheme. It is also known as AM-GRIS. AICTE, on 23rd February 2018, entered into a Memorandum of Understanding with Mathematics of Information Technology and Computer Systems (MITACS) Canada for AICTE – MITACS Globalink Research Internships (GRI) Program to foster cross-border partnerships focused on creating a platform that opens the path for collaborative research between Canada and India to a wider pool of student talent in India. The implementing agency is AICTE And Mitacs. Additionally, the nodal ministry is Ministry of Education and the nodal department is Department Of Higher Education. It falls under the categories: Education & Learning.

Eligibility criteria include: The applicant must be a 3rdyear fulltime student of an undergraduate program (B. E / B. Tech) in AICTE Approved Institution in the year of application. org/sites/default/files/stdc/Mitacs%20Scheme%20Guidelines. pdf"}], "schemeImageUrl": "", "briefDescription": "AICTE, on 23rd February 2018, entered into a Memorandum of Understanding with Mathematics of Information Technology and Computer Systems (MITACS) Canada for AICTE \u2013 MITACS Globalink Research Internships (GRI) Program to foster cross-border partnerships. The AICTE-MITACS GRI Program is open to Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) disciplines. The duration of the internship is 12 weeks. A maximum of 300 students are accepted in a financial year. It will also include access to Globalink branded activities in Canada, which may include professional skills workshops, receptions, and industrial engagement activities.
